title: Analysis of f based on table of values for f, f'

content.question: Let f be a function that is differentiable for all real numbers. The table above gives the values of f and its derivative f' for selected points x in the closed interval <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mo>−</mo> <mn>1.5</mn> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>1.5</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaaeaaaaaaaaa8 qacqGHsislcaaIXaGaaiOlaiaaiwdacqGHKjYOcaWG4bGaeyizImQa aGymaiaac6cacaaI1aaaaa@3FC2@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>. The second derivative of f has the property that f''(x) > 0 for <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mo>−</mo> <mn>1.5</mn> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>1.5</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaaeaaaaaaaaa8 qacqGHsislcaaIXaGaaiOlaiaaiwdacqGHKjYOcaWG4bGaeyizImQa aGymaiaac6cacaaI1aaaaa@3FC2@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>. (a) Evaluate <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>0</mn> <mrow> <mn>1.5</mn> </mrow> </msubsup> <mrow> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mn>3</mn> <msup> <mi>f</mi> <mo>′</mo> </msup> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>+</mo> <mn>4</mn> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaaeaaaaaaaaa8 qadaWdXaWdaeaapeWaaeWaa8aabaWdbiaaiodaceWGMbGbauaadaqa daWdaeaapeGaamiEaaGaayjkaiaawMcaaiabgUcaRiaaisdaaiaawI cacaGLPaaaaSWdaeaapeGaaGimaaWdaeaapeGaaGymaiaac6cacaaI 1aaaniabgUIiYdaaaa@4323@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>dx. Show the work that leads to your answer.

frqParts.text: Let f be a function that is differentiable for all real numbers. The table above gives the values of f and its derivative f' for selected points x in the closed interval <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mo>−</mo> <mn>1.5</mn> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>1.5</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaaeaaaaaaaaa8 qacqGHsislcaaIXaGaaiOlaiaaiwdacqGHKjYOcaWG4bGaeyizImQa aGymaiaac6cacaaI1aaaaa@3FC2@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>. The second derivative of f has the property that f''(x) > 0 for <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mo>−</mo> <mn>1.5</mn> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>1.5</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaaeaaaaaaaaa8 qacqGHsislcaaIXaGaaiOlaiaaiwdacqGHKjYOcaWG4bGaeyizImQa aGymaiaac6cacaaI1aaaaa@3FC2@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>. (a) Evaluate <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>0</mn> <mrow> <mn>1.5</mn> </mrow> </msubsup> <mrow> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mn>3</mn> <msup> <mi>f</mi> <mo>′</mo> </msup> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>+</mo> <mn>4</mn> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaaeaaaaaaaaa8 qadaWdXaWdaeaapeWaaeWaa8aabaWdbiaaiodaceWGMbGbauaadaqa daWdaeaapeGaamiEaaGaayjkaiaawMcaaiabgUcaRiaaisdaaiaawI cacaGLPaaaaSWdaeaapeGaaGimaaWdaeaapeGaaGymaiaac6cacaaI 1aaaniabgUIiYdaaaa@4323@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>dx. Show the work that leads to your answer.

(b) Write an equation of the line tangent to the graph of f at the point where x = 1. Use this line to approximate the value of f(1.2). Is this approximation greater than or less than the actual value of f(1.2)? Give a reason for your answer.
(c) Find a positive real number r having the property that there must exist a value c with 0 < c < 0.5 and f''(c) = r. Give a reason for your answer.

(d) Let g be the function given by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>g</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo>=</mo> <mrow> <mo>{</mo> <mrow> <mtable> <mtr> <mtd> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mo>−</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>−</mo> <mn>7</mn> <mtext>   for </mtext> <mi>x</mi> <mo><</mo> <mn>0</mn> </mrow> </mtd> </mtr> <mtr> <mtd> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mo>+</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>−</mo> <mn>7</mn> <mtext>   for </mtext> <mi>x</mi> <mo>≥</mo> <mn>0.</mn> </mrow> </mtd> </mtr> </mtable> </mrow> </mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@5982@</annotation> </semantics> </math> The graph of g passes through each of the points (x, f(x)) given in the table above. Is it possible that f and g are the same function? Give a reason for your answer.

skill.text: Skill 1.F: Explain how an approximated value relates to the actual value.
